paragraphs.text: Dark Into Light is a game hosted by Nick.com, based on the television series The Legend of Korra. The player runs through scenery from the show as either Korra or Bolin, bending at or jumping over enemies and obstacles in the way. It can be used to unlock exclusive images from Book Two: Spirits.

paragraphs.body: Play as Korra or Bolin and beat as many missions and stages as possible to restore balance and unlock new abilities.
paragraphs.text: Play as Korra or Bolin and beat as many missions and stages as possible to restore balance and unlock new abilities.

paragraphs.body: The game is played through different stages. Upon starting the game, the player will be presented with four menus, one for controls, one for unlocking codes, one for exclusive content and one for playing the game. This link will lead a player to the menu for stages, where there are several stages they can choose from each with numerous missions in them. The default mission for the stage is opened with a brief conversation between Korra and another character from the series. There are four levels set in the South Pole, one in Republic City, two in the Fire Nation (set in the same location), two in the Eastern Air Temple, and one in Ba Sing Se.

paragraphs.body: To defeat the lizard spirit, the player must draw the lizard's attention and time their jump to avoid its attack. The lizard can only be damaged for a brief interval after it misses an attack and hits its head against a wall. The player can tell that the lizard can be damaged by looking at the color of its glow. If it glows blue, it can be damaged.

paragraphs.body: The stage is very straightforward, consisting only of a fight with Unalaq. During the fight, Unalaq uses many ranged ice attacks and blocks all of Korra's ranged attacks. Unalaq can also summon dark spirits to help him. Upon defeating him, an excerpt of "Darkness Falls" showing Unalaq extracting and destroying Raava, growing to gigantic proportions, and leaving through the spirit lights is shown. The game tells that the era of the Avatar is not over yet, and that Korra can still connect to the cosmos.
